TextLibrary.Text: Sable
I met with our contact again--
I met with our contact again. Seems the Alloy delivery went to their liking.

Wait a minute. Before you continue, why is it that we always get notified we need to meet with their contact when we're in orbit of Serpens III but they always want us to meet them in Serpens Station?
Well it wasn't really that difficult. They actually paid us a little too. I didn't expect that.

Good question. We've been to his manor, we know where to find him personally. It could be that his activities involving us aren't sanctioned by the rest of the MRI, and he can fly under the radar if we meet a contact at a busy hub like Serpens Station instead of meeting with him directly.
True, but it was necessary to prove we could get what we needed from our surroundings. I suppose he thinks we'll need such a skill with our future testing out their technology.
Interesting. That makes me wonder what our next task is going to be?
Alright then. You met with the contact, what are we to do next?
Two more convicts have been released from their life imprisonment solely so we can find and destroy them.
Two more convicts have been released from their life imprisonment solely so we can find and destroy them.
Alright, have they been marked like the last one?
Is that even legal? Isn't that trading their life sentences for death penalties? Seems like an awful thing to do, even to a couple of convicts.
Yes, they should be somewhere in the Apus System according to our tracking device. We need to find them before they discover and remove their signal beacons.
Well how do you think he earned the name, Nasty Butler?
Alright, anything special about these convicts I should know?
I thought you said there wasn't a story behind his name?
They were skilled pirates before they were captured, and that wasn't long ago. You can expect them to be skilled Pilots and Gunners.
There isn't.
I'll keep that in mind. To the Apus System then.
